intro: Chamaemyrrhis eriopoda, commonly known as the woolly chamaemyrrhis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in the spring. Its aromatic foliage and unique morphology make it a notable species in its native habitat. Chamaemyrrhis eriopoda is often found in open woodlands and scrublands, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
